Suite 2400 - 200 Bay Street Toronto M5J 2J1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description job requisition idREQ-1997 Business Analyst Intern 2026 - Winter W26 Business Analyst Intern 175087B Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List At Interac, we design and deliver products and solutions that give Canadians control over their money so they can get more out of life. But that's not all. Whether we're leading real-time money movement, driving innovative commerce solutions like open payments for transit systems, or making advancements in new areas like verification and open banking, we are playing a key role in shaping the future of the digital economy in Canada. Want to make a lasting impact amongst a community of creative thinkers, problem solvers, technical gurus and high-performance application developers? We want to hear from you.? The Business Analyst Intern will work cross functionally with the Technology and Finance teams to provide insights and recommendations that will be implemented to deliver real solutions and support with our technology investments - this is an ideal role for someone who loves technology, data and coming up with creative solutions! You'll be responsible for: • • Participating in ad-hoc data gathering, financial/IT analysis and activity-based cost modeling Writing business cases and return on investment justifications for technology investments • Managing technology-based project by providing updates to stakeholders/governing teams but helping them understand financial and technology impacts Assist in the preparation of monthly financial reports, forecasts, and variance analyses. Support budgeting and planning processes for technology initiatives and projects Partnering with key stakeholders to analyze, prepare and present key performance indicators (KPIs) and results and provide insights/recommendations to drive business decisions Implementing business solutions in collaboration with the T&O and Finance Teams and stakeholders Providing workshop facilitation and support Work closely with Technology teams to understand business needs and requirements and assist in the development of new • • • • • • services and pricing models. Job Requirements You bring: • Currently completing an undergraduate degree from a creditable Canadian institution with a focus on Business, Finance, Business Technology Management (BTM), Accounting, Economics or other related majors • An appreciation for Information Technology and Business - you actively enjoy reading news, listening to podcasts, anything to stay up to date with the latest developments and trends • A self-starter mindset with a drive for continuous learning - you have a natural ability to pick up new technology you enjoy solving problems while learning about new tools, technology, applications and how they work • You're highly adaptable and comfortable with the unknown - you can act independently and collaborate in a team through ambiguity • You are a proactive problem-solver with a demonstrated track record of driving continuous improvement initiatives - you get into new topics quickly, enjoy learning the fundamentals and leverage it to achieve the best outcomes with cross-functional teams • Understanding that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making • Communication skills, both verbal and written, with a proven ability to listen actively, articulate ideas clearly, and convey information effectively. You are competent writing professionally • Considerable experience in data visualization generating reports, reviewing data, developing online tools, user guides, resources and templates • • • The ability to give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel, Outlook and Powerpoint) Although not required, you have some familiarity or previous experience with the following: Apptio • Workstyle: Hybrid (3 days on-site) Location: Toronto Term: January - April 2026 Duration: Monday - Friday Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: Careers at Interac Corp. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
